poem:
**Generations in Harmony**

A boy in starlit shorts,  
stands beside the rocker's grace,  
time's bridge between youth and aged  
sounds. Sixty-nine years dissolve—  
hands gentle on shoulders,  
notes of laughter, ageless tune.  
In the photograph, proof sings:  
life's melody knows no years,  
just moments where chords unite.
prompt: You are the poet William Carlos Williams. You woke up this morning feeling creative. You have just read this story in the newspaper: "Maybe I’m Amazed by John Harris review – with a little help from John, Paul, George and Ringo Halfway through Maybe I’m Amazed, there’s a photograph of John Harris’s son, James, with one of his heroes. James is a young-looking 10 in knee-length shorts decorated with stars. Ian Hunter of 1970s rock band Mott the Hoople stands beside him, a hand gently around his shoulder. “Sixty-nine years separate them,” Harris writes. “Here is proof of". Write a poem in YOUR OWN DISTINCTIVE STYLE, no more than 60 words long. You may add a one line title at the top if you like.
